entry.tran: 像教授的；有学者风范的
entry.def: If you describe someone as professorial, you mean that they look or behave like a professor.

example.ex: His manner is not so much regal as professorial...
example.tran: 他的言行举止不太像帝王，倒更像学者一些。

example.ex: I raised my voice to a professorial tone.
example.tran: 我提高了嗓音，像教授一样说话。

entry.tran: 和教授（或大学教师）工作有关的
entry.def: Professorial means relating to the work of a professor.

example.ex: ...the cuts which have led to 36 per cent of professorial posts remaining unfilled.
example.tran: 裁员导致36%的教授职位空缺

means.word_mean: 1. relating to or characteristic of professors;

auth_sentence.content: His manner is friendly, more professorial than priestly.
auth_sentence.res_content: His manner is friendly, more professorial than priestly.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His manner is friendly, more professorial than priestly.

auth_sentence.content: But the decision clearly weighed on the professorial magistrate.
auth_sentence.res_content: But the decision clearly weighed on the professorial magistrate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But the decision clearly weighed on the professorial magistrate.

auth_sentence.content: Beware the dictatorship of any professorial elite!
auth_sentence.res_content: Beware the dictatorship of any professorial elite!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Beware the dictatorship of any professorial elite!
